metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2731 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff's LZWDecode() function in the libtiff/tif_lzw.c file. This flaw allows a local attacker to craft specific input data that can cause the program to dereference a NULL pointer when decompressing a TIFF format file, resulting in a program crash or denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.5.0-5ubuntu1.1
libtiff-tools - 4.5.0-5ubuntu1.1
libtiff6 - 4.5.0-5ubuntu1.1
libtiffxx6 - 4.5.0-5ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.0-5ubuntu1.1').
